column3: Automatic sanity-testing: PASSED, see http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/a79bb07800bbc8c72cf97cf8b34e9137ea84b03a for binaries and test log.\n
Automatic sanity-testing: PASSED, see http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/54413aab135aa84f60bfcb477a4d2ecfb72edbac for binaries and test log.\n
Is there some background to this? I don't understand why...\n

The client estimates the current block count by averaging the block counts
of connected clients. When you have just received the latest one, then your
block count can be above the average.

Nothing to see here, move along.

On 16 January 2013 14:43, Luke-Jr notifications@github.com wrote:

wouldn't "emit numBlocksChanges(newNumBlocks, std::max(newNumBlocksOfPeers, newNumBlocks))" be the same?\n
Yeah, that's better, thanks for mentioning :).\n
